name: K2-265
scenarioDescription:
The K2-265 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-265 is a star with 0.92 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.98 times its radius. It is located 454.07438319999994 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 9.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-265 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-265 system

K2-265 b

K2-265 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the Transit method. The mass of K2-265 b is 6.54 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-265 b is 1.71 that of Earth. At 6.54 Earth masses, K2-265 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-265, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
